item.title: Automate your game builds in Github with GameCI and Github Actions
item.description: Building Unity projects are relatively quick and consistent, but most of the time this renders your computer unusable until it is complete, thankfully we have GameCI to the rescue. For this article I will showcase how I used GameCI and Github Actions in order to help me and my teammates develop our game Get Guns, Go Grapple. As always, to get a better understanding of the tools presented in this article, I recommend reading the documentation for each tool if available.

item.title: Building Aseprite from source without using Visual Studio for Windows
item.description: Aseprite is a pixel-art tool to create 2D animations, sprites, and any kind of graphics for games. item.title: Setting up my computer for game development in Unity
item.description: Hello, in this post I will show how I set up my computer for game development in Unity. item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hi, my name is Jolo. I am currently a game development student residing in the Philippines. I mostly make games in Unity, but I also tend to check out other tech in my free time. In this site, I plan to document the things I use and find interesting, as well as post stuff about my projects down the line. Aside from game development, in my free time I play video games (obviously), read manga, watch vtubers, and learn more about tech both in hardware and software.
